definition: 4th note in pentatonic scale 五音[wu3 yin1], roughly sol/see also 徵|征[zheng1]
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: The new government imposed a special tax  on imported wines.
sentences.chinese: 新政府對進口酒徵收特別稅。

sentences.english: Moses therefore took the money of them that were above, and whom they had redeemed from the Levites.
sentences.chinese: 梅瑟就爲那超過肋未人數而應贖回的人，徵收了贖金。

sentences.english: The Ministry of Land and Resources has charged added-value fees for land reserves.
sentences.chinese: 國土資源部已開始對“囤地”徵收增值地價。

sentences.english: In 1767 Britain put customs duty on many goods such as tea.
sentences.chinese: 1767年，英國對許多貨物徵收關稅，例如茶葉。

sentences.english: The takings clause mediates between the police power and the eminent domain power.
sentences.chinese: 徵收條款是在警察權有償取得財產權的調和。

sentences.english: The government plans to slap a new tariff on imported goods.
sentences.chinese: 政府計劃對進口貨物徵收新關銳。

sentences.english: Levying a tax on leaded gasoline is an important policy to implement the use of unleaded gasoline.
sentences.chinese: 徵收含鉛汽油稅是實行汽油無鉛化的一項重要政策。

sentences.english: The introduction of a new tax accounted in no small measure for the downfall of the government.
sentences.chinese: 這屆政府的垮臺在很大程度上歸因於徵收一種新稅。

sentences.english: The income tax is to be reimposed next year after ten years' exemption.
sentences.chinese: 所得稅經過十年的豁免後將於明年重新徵收。

sentences.english: US keeps duties on China's pipe fittings .
sentences.chinese: 美國繼續徵收碳鋼對焊管件反傾銷稅。

sentences.english: Everyone grumbled at the imposition of new taxes.
sentences.chinese: 對徵收新加的賦稅人人都抱怨。

sentences.english: Therefore, to timely collect environmental taxation is imperative.
sentences.chinese: 因而，適時徵收環境稅已勢在必行。

sentences.english: Ad valorem duties are levied on the basis of the product's value.
sentences.chinese: 從價稅是以商品的價值爲基礎而徵收的稅。

sentences.english: As a counter-measure, they impose duties under the multilateral WTO regime.
sentences.chinese: 作爲反制措施，他們在WTO多邊機制下徵收稅收。

sentences.english: When there is an indirect tax on commodity, supply decreases.
sentences.chinese: 當向商品徵收間接稅，供應減少。

sentences.english: Thee U. S. government imposed a high tariff on foreign products to maintain profitability.
sentences.chinese: 美國政府爲了保持盈利對外國產品徵收高額關稅。

definition: to reduce or waive (taxes, punishment, rent, tuition etc)
taxation/in former times, esp. land tax
